info.name: Pyramidal decussation
info.description: The pyramidal decussation is where the corticospinal tract fibers that travel through the pyramid of the medulla, cross or decussate the midline of the neuraxis. This decussation marks the boundary between the medulla and spinal cord. As this tract travels in the spinal cord, it is known as the lateral corticospinal tract. Note that a few corticospinal fibers do not cross in this decussation and thus remain in a vental location in the spinal cord where they are known as the ventral corticospinal tract; these ventral corticospinal fibers generally descend only to cervical segments and will decussate in the ventral white commissure of the spinal cord before they synapse in the ventral horn.
